aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Computer and Communications Systems Vulnerability Risks
Amazon's computer and communications systems have been damaged or interrupted in the past.
Amazon's computer and communications systems could be damaged or interrupted in the future.
Natural disasters can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Human-caused disasters can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Public health crises are considered human-caused disasters that can affect Amazon's systems.
Extreme weather can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Climate change can result in extreme weather that affects Amazon's systems.
Geopolitical events can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Security issues can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Terrorist attacks are security issues that can damage Amazon's systems.
Armed hostilities are security issues that can damage Amazon's systems.
Computer viruses can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Physical break-ins can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Electronic break-ins can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Operational failures can damage or interrupt Amazon's computer and communications systems.
Energy shortages can cause operational failures in Amazon's systems.
System interruptions can prevent Amazon from accepting customer orders.
System interruptions can prevent Amazon from fulfilling customer orders.
System interruptions can prevent Amazon from providing services.
System delays can prevent Amazon from accepting and fulfilling customer orders and providing services.
Loss of critical data can prevent Amazon from accepting and fulfilling customer orders and providing services.
System disruptions can make Amazon's product offerings less attractive.
System disruptions can make Amazon's service offerings less attractive.
System disruptions can subject Amazon to liability.
Amazon's systems are not fully redundant.
Amazon's disaster recovery planning may not be sufficient.
Amazon's insurance may not provide sufficient coverage to compensate for system-related losses.
System disruptions can damage Amazon's reputation.
Remedying system disruptions can be expensive for Amazon.

text: Our computer and communications systems and operations in the past have been, or in the future could be, damaged or interrupted due to events such as natural or human-caused disasters (including public health crises) or extreme weather (including as a result of climate change), geopolitical events and security issues (including terrorist attacks and armed hostilities), computer viruses, physical or electronic break-ins, operational failures (including from energy shortages), and similar events or disruptions. Any of these events could cause system interruption, delays, and loss of critical data, and could prevent us from accepting and fulfilling customer orders and providing services, which could make our product and service offerings less attractive and subject us to liability. Our systems are not fully redundant and our disaster recovery planning may not be sufficient. In addition, our insurance may not provide sufficient coverage to compensate for related losses. Any of these events could damage our reputation and be expensive to remedy.
